qas.question: What did the United States pass in 2004?

answers.text: amendment to the Fair Labour Standards Act of 1938

qas.question: What is the age of US children allowed to work outside of the home?
What culture in the US benefits from this Act?
What grade do Amish children need to pass in order to be able to work for their families?

context: In 2004, the United States passed an <a0_0>amendment to the Fair Labour Standards Act of 1938<a0_0/>. The amendment allows certain children <a1_0>aged 14–18<a1_0/> to work in or outside a business where machinery is used to process wood. The law aims to respect the religious and cultural needs of the <a2_0>Amish<a2_0/> community of the United States. The Amish believe that one effective way to educate children is on the job. The new law allows Amish children the ability to work with their families, once they are passed <a3_0>eighth grade<a3_0/> in school.
